cuepoints.caption: Let's review some steps to maintain your Gemini Touch.
Let's take a look at the Bill Acceptor.
Since we know money can be quite dirty, and people sometimes try to put other items into vending terminals, this can require cleaning.
Cleaning the Bill Acceptor is very easy to do.
In order to clean this component of the terminal, the acceptor module must be removed from the chassis in order to open the front sensor area.

overlays.label: Remove the BA Module from the Chassis

cuepoints.caption: Not removing it from the chassis could cause damage.
To open the Bill Acceptor door, insert the BA key into the lock,
turn to the right,
and gently tilt the assembly down.
Remove the Bill Acceptor by pushing up the silver latching bar
and pulling straight out.
Gently lift the read head from the Bill Acceptor.
Clear the bill path area of any foreign objects.
Using a soft cloth,
wipe the bill path and sensor areas as needed.
Be sure to also wipe the side walls of the optics housing.
To reinstall the acceptor module, simply close it
and reinsert it back into the machine.
Press it back gently so it locks into place.
To close the Bill Accepter compartment, lift up the door, and close firmly.
Lock the Bill Acceptor door by turning the key to the left
and remove the key.
OK, let's look at how to clean the Play Slip Reader.
The Play Slip Reader is located here below the Bill Acceptor.
To open the Play Slip Reader, gently lift up on the black raised lever.
The reader itself is located on the bottom of the upper area inside the white strip.
To clean it use a clean, dry, soft cloth dampened with water
and gently wipe the reader glass until all dirt particles are removed.
To close the Play Slip Reader, just press down until it clicks.
That's it! Let's move on.
